abstract.para: &abstract-geoquick; This document guides you through the basic setup of a &geo; cluster, using the &geo; cluster bootstrap scripts provided by the ha-cluster-bootstrap package.

dm:bugtracker.dm:product: SUSE Linux Enterprise High Availability Extension 12 SP3

sect1.title: Usage Scenario
sect1.para: &geo; clusters based on &productname; can be considered overlay clusters where each cluster site corresponds to a cluster node in a traditional cluster. The overlay cluster is managed by the booth mechanism. It guarantees that the cluster resources will be highly available across different cluster sites. This is achieved by using cluster objects called tickets that are treated as failover domain between cluster sites, in case a site should be down. Booth guarantees that every ticket is granted to no more than one site at a time.
